```python
# game_fns.py

def game_fn_init(a) {
    print(a)
}
```

```python
# game.py

def main():
    while True:
        grug_reload_mods()
        update()
```

# Generated once

```c
// grug_bindings.c
// Generated by bindgen.py using mod_api.json

// TODO: How can demo.c call this?
void game_fn_init(char *a) {
    python_call("game_fn_init", a)
}
```

```python
# grug_bindings.py
# Generated by bindgen.py using mod_api.json

def grug_reload_mods():
    return c_call("grug_reload_mods")

# TODO: Somehow store all the on_fns of an entity in a struct/dict,
# TODO: so the game can call the fns as easily as the C/C++ version can
def a_on_shoot():
    return c_call("a_on_shoot")
```
